fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The [https://www.atlassian.com/es/git/tutorials/git-show] page doesn't show any content
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Visit the https://www.atlassian.com/es/git/tutorials/git-show page

h3. Expected Results
Being able to view the content
h3. Actual Results
Empty page
h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: https://www.atlassian.com/es/git/tutorials/git-show page doesn't work

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The numbering bracket fail to add new line in the readme

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create readme add:
{code}
1) one
2) two
3) three
{code}
# Save or preview

h3. Expected Results
It should add a new line into the numbering 
 !Screenshot 2021-01-29 at 12.33.16 PM.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Actual Results
The numbering is not added into a new line instead become one line
 !Screenshot 2021-01-29 at 12.33.24 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Add another empty space in between the numbering for example:
{code}
1) one

2) two

3) three
{code}
fields.summary: Readme fail to create new space on bracket numbering

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Re-inviting users through *Add members* will not trigger the invite email.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Invite user through *Add members*
 # User is stuck in the bounce list
 # Remove the bounce
 # Re-invite user through *Add members*

h3. Expected Results
* Invite email should be a trigger
h3. Actual Results
* Invite email is not triggered

h3. Workaround
The workaround is to manually select the group the user was invited previously and click *re-sent invite email* to trigger the invite email
fields.summary: Unable to re-invite the user using Add members menu

fields.description: Currently the Bitbucket API supports [stopping a pipeline|https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Bworkspace%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/pipelines/%7Bpipeline_uuid%7D/stopPipeline], it would be more helpful to have the ability to trigger a pipeline over REST
fields.summary: Add Start Pipeline to REST API

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
* Currently, the option to sync projects on the Chrome browser with your local smart mirror is not working.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On your Premium Bitbucket workspace, set up a smart mirror on https://bitbucket.org/<workspace_id>/workspace/settings/mirroring/
 # Using the Chrome browser, try to sync a project with your smart mirror;

h3. Expected Results
The syncing for your projects should work just fine using the chrome browser;

h3. Actual Results
The syncing fails with a permission error {code}{"errors":[{"context":null,"message":"You are not permitted to access this resource","exceptionName":"com.atlassian.bitbucket.AuthorisationException"}]}{code}

h3. Workaround

The option to sync projects is working fine through the Firefox browser, so that can be used as a workaround.
fields.summary: Sync projects with smart mirror not working on Chrome browser
Dynamic deployment enviroments

fields.description:
As of now when we list contents, we will have a table with header

*Branch, Behind, Ahead, Updated, Pull Request, Builds, Actions.*

And with in the Actions three dots ... we have the following 

View Source, Compare, Delete, Run pipeline on the Branch.

Is it possible one more items like "Add Note" or "Add Description".

 

As this will help us to note down the latest status of the branch, like the action plan or current status, or some explanation like why this branch is not merger or why its left open etc.
fields.summary: Note or Description section of Branch

fields.description: If a comment was addressed without having to make additional code changes, give the reviewer an option to Resolve the comment, instead of having to delete the comment all together.
fields.summary: Have a Resolve button for pull request comments

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently, it is possible to delete the target branch for an open PR, which causes a few issues on the platform.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a PR to *branch1*;
 # Leave that PR as open, 
 # Go to repository branches view or use BB API > Delete  *branch1* ;
 # go back to the open PR where  *branch1*  was a destination branch > try to leave a comment > will result in 400 response
 # try to merge the same PR > merge will be successful and the deleted  *branch1* will be re-created.

h3. Expected Results
 # Branch deletion that is part of an open PR should give a warning;
 # leaving a comment on the same open PR shouldn't result in 400 - since the PR does exist and we allow it to still be merged successfully

h3. Actual Results
 # Branch that is part of an open PR is allowed to be deleted without any warning;
 # This causes new comments to that PR error out with user error (400);
 # Users are even allowed to approve and merge PR successfully, where destination branch was previously deleted and that branch is re-created again after the merge

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Deleting target branch for an open PR is permitted

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When trying to go to the next page of snippets in [https://bitbucket.org/<workspace>/workspace/snippets/<snippetname>/revisions/?page=2|https://bitbucket.org/%3Cworkspace%3E/workspace/snippets/%3Csnippetname%3E/revisions/?page=2] you still just get the first page, no matter what page# you are on.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to [https://bitbucket.org/]<workspace>/workspace/snippets/<snippetname>/revisions/
 # Press Page 2 or Page 3

h3. Expected Results

See different results (a new page of snippets)
h3. Actual Results

See the same page of snippets.
  
h3. Workaround

Go to [https://bitbucket.org/<workspace>/workspace/snippets/<snippetname>/revisions/?page=2|https://bitbucket.org/delan/workspace/snippets/kxyjaj/revisions/?page=2] from scratch (in a new tab)
fields.summary: Pagination in Snippets list's revision doesn't work

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Password with special characters in the Webhook URL is causing 403 error 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a webhook with a password attribute in the URL - https://<webhook-url>/scripts.php?password=*saHF#{NDFSIN

h3. Expected Results

Expected to trigger successfully 

h3. Actual Results

403 - "Error in creating webhook with URI XXXX"

h3. Workaround

Updating the password in the URL to something without any special characters fixed the issue.
fields.summary: Password with special characters in the Webhook URL is causing 403 error

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Headings 4 and 5 capitalizes the characters in PR Description field

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a PR
 # Type a content in the PR's description
# Apply "heading 4 or 5" on the content

h3. Expected Results
# The content shouldn't be capitalized, when we apply heading 4 or 5

h3. Actual Results
# The content is getting capitalized
 !heading.gif! 
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Headings 4 and 5 capitalizes the characters in PR Description field

fields.description:
Currently, once a pull-request has already been merged, there does not seem to be a way to approve or reject it (mark it as "needs more work").  As a result, there are only two modes of operation:
 # PR approval is required - developer is blocked waiting for approval before he can merge.
 # PR approval is not required - developer can merge at will, but ability to approve/reject PRs is lost.

Mode #1 is preferred, but it is too strict and results in slower development progress.  Also, it is not ideal during these days of the pandemic, when many people are working from home, and are working at different times during the day - developers working after core hours are forced to wait until the next day for their PR to be approved so that they could merge their changes. 

The only way to get around this "synchronous" mode of operation is to switch to mode #2 by completely removing PR approval requirement.  That is not ideal, because you completely lose ability to approve/reject PRs because a merged PR can no longer be approved/rejected.

It would be nice if there were a third mode of operation, which is a middle-ground between the two modes above.  It would be nice if PR approval requirement could be removed to allow developers to merge without approval, but still allow reviewers to approve/reject PRs after they've already been merged.  In this optional mode of operation developers could merge at will, and reviewers could review the PRs at a later time, and approve/reject them.  This mode of operation would allow developers and reviewers to operate "asynchronously", and would still allow project-managers to ensure that all code changes have been reviewed and approved prior to a release - they would not release until all merged PRs have been approved (and none of them are tagged as "needs more work").
fields.summary: Add optional ability to approve/reject pull-requests which have already been merged

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Admins have the ability to set a link between Bitbucket and an external application from *Repository settings* *> Links*, by setting up a custom link.

When there is a requirement to do this for a large number of repos in a certain workspace, the process of setting this up in all repos, one by one, can be time consuming.
h3. Suggested Solution

Allow admins to set up custom links at the workspace level, from workspace *Settings*, that will apply to all workspace repos, or with the ability to select which workspace repos this will apply to.
fields.summary: Ability to create custom links at workspace level

fields.description:
I tried to figure out where to report this; unfortunately, there is no obvious place to report this, so BBCLOUD is as close as I was able to get.

Git tutorial, here: [https://www.atlassian.com/git/tutorials/]

All the multi-line code samples and console examples are broken. They are all streamed onto one line. This makes deciphering some of the more complex examples quite difficult, especially if one is very new to using Git or the shell CLI
fields.summary: Bitbucket Git tutorials have broken formatting

fields.description:
Hello,

May I make a suggestion to improve the "Filtering files in this repository" function.

When inserting a word in the search box, I would expect all files with that full word in their file names as a result. What happens now is that the result are all files whose path and filenames allow the formation of that word. 

For example, searching for the word "balena" in returns these results:
 
 /Filtering files in this repository...
||Name||
| |[static/vendor/datata*b*les/js/d*a*taTab*le*s.fou*n*d*a*tion.js|https://bitbucket.org/indizen/dashboard-alstom/src/master/static/vendor/datatables/js/dataTables.foundation.js]|
| |[static/vendor/datata*b*les/css/d*a*taTab*le*s.fou*n*d*a*tion.css|https://bitbucket.org/indizen/dashboard-alstom/src/master/static/vendor/datatables/css/dataTables.foundation.css]|
| |[static/vendor/datata*b*les/js/d*a*taTab*le*s.fou*n*d*a*tion.min.js|https://bitbucket.org/indizen/dashboard-alstom/src/master/static/vendor/datatables/js/dataTables.foundation.min.js]|
| |[static/vendor/datata*b*les/css/d*a*taTab*le*s.fou*n*d*a*tion.min.css|https://bitbucket.org/indizen/dashboard-alstom/src/master/static/vendor/datatables/css/dataTables.foundation.min.css]|

 

Someone might find it useful, but I do think most users would prefer to keep the results to the files that actually have all the letters in the same order and without any character in between. That's is, the whole word balena in this example.

 

Thanks in advance for reading this, and I hope a new "search whole word" option is available soon.

Regards,

Henar
fields.summary: Filtering files by text

fields.description:
Currently, the new PR UI commit section doesn't have approve and comment count in the UI compared to the old legacy UI as below:
Old UI:
 !Screenshot 2021-01-22 at 9.36.21 AM.png|thumbnail! 

New UI:
 !Screenshot 2021-01-22 at 9.46.39 AM.png|thumbnail! 

Adding this to the new PR UI would really be helpful to customer migrating from legacy UI to the new UI.
fields.summary: Add approve and comment count in the new PR UI commit section

fields.description:
In the old PR view within Bitbucket UI, when user is using API or a third party tool is using Bitbucket API to post build status updates, we would record all updates for the same build key under Activity Feed. It would contain status and the commit for which the build is run. 

In the new PR view > Build section, we only reflect the latest status of the build for the same build key, we no longer show the progression of the status updated for the same build key. 

 

Please incorporate this functionality in the NEW PR view on Bitbucket, to allow users the track the progression of the build in Bitbucket UI for the same build key as used by third party plugins. 

 

*Use case:* Jenkins pipeline job has several stages (Build, test, scan, etc) and would push a SUCCESS or FAILED for each along with a description. The purpose is to have a visual in Bitbucket of where in the stages did it fail. If failure, then we pushed a comment with the last 20 lines for context on the error to help developer go back and identify and correct the issue that caused the build failure.
fields.summary: For New PR view - display entire build status updates for the same build key and include code snippets

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Bitbucket is not rendering the favicon on /dashboard/overview page

 !image-2021-01-20-13-32-26-258.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access Bitbucket.org
 # Navigate to the https://bitbucket.org/dashboard/overview page

h3. Expected Results

The favicon should be loaded the same way that it is on the Pull Request page:
 !image-2021-01-20-13-38-02-390.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

The favicon is not loading:

 !image-2021-01-20-13-32-26-258.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Use a third-party application to update the favicon
e.g
https://github.com/sylouuu/chrome-tab-modifier/blob/master/README.md
fields.summary: No favicon on /dashboard/overview page in Google Chrome

fields.description:
When a commit is associated with more than one tag, through the UI, when viewing that specific commit, it is not possible to view all of the tags, as their name get truncated like so:
 !Screen Shot 2021-01-29 at 12.42.47.png|thumbnail! 
It would be great if the tags were displayed in multiple lines in order to facilitate the viewing of multiple tags.
fields.summary: Commit view with multiple tags

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Enabling Embedded HTML in markdown in Labs caused [TOS] not to render. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Enable Enabling Embedded HTML in markdown in Labs 
 # Create Readme.md or Wiki with the following test:
{code}
[TOC]

# Header 1

## Header 2
{code}

h3. Expected Results
The [TOS] render as expected

h3. Actual Results
[TOS] markdown is not rendered.

h3. Workaround

Disable Embedded HTML in markdown in Labs and edit Readme.md or wiki then saving it will render the [TOS].
fields.summary: Enabling Embedded HTML in markdown in Labs caused [TOS] not to render

fields.description:
We would like to have the ability to customize the Pull Request view to look similar to Bitbucket Server.

We believe that the way that Bitbucket Server UI is displayed looks better than the actual Bitbucket Cloud Pull Request.
eg.

 !image-2021-01-18-14-22-44-522.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Allow users to customize the Pull Request view
Improve API documentation for creating Pipelines Deployment environment

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When the Pull Request approvals are reset, the PR doesn't appear in the "Needs my approval" overview again  to the reviewers 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Enable the Premium feature "Reset approvals when the source branch is modified"
 # Create a Pull request
 # Add a reviewer to the PR
 # When the reviewer accesses the page [https://bitbucket.org/dashboard/overview], they will be able to see the PR under the "Needs my approval" option
 # The reviewer approves the PR
 # Add a new file to the source branch to reset the approvals
 # When the reviewer accesses the page [https://bitbucket.org/dashboard/overview], they will not be able to see the PR under the "Needs my approval" option

h3. Expected Results

After changing the source branch and the approvals are reset, when the reviewer accesses the page [https://bitbucket.org/dashboard/overview], they should see the PR under the "Needs my approval" option again
h3. Actual Results

After changing the source branch and the approvals are reset, when the reviewer accesses the page [https://bitbucket.org/dashboard/overview], they will not be able to see the PR under the "Needs my approval" option
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: PR will not appear on the user BB dashboard again after approvals were reset
git documentation issue

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Added comment after clicking reload PR page will change the comment line after a web browser refresh

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a branch
# Create a file with several lines of text (distinct lines are best to make it more obvious when comments end up in the wrong place)
# Commit the file, pushing it to the branch
# Create a PR to merge the branch back into the master
# With the PR open in a Chrome tab, add some additional lines
# Commit the additional lines and push them onto the same branch
# Wait for the "reload page" prompt to appear; when it does, click on it
# The pr is now updated showing a new line added
# Comment on one of the additional lines
#* Example, the comment is added on line #7
 !Screenshot 2021-01-15 at 10.49.43 AM.png|thumbnail! 
# Once the comment has been saved, it should appear on the line you add the comment
# Reload the page using the browser reload or open it in a new tab
#* After reloading the page using browser refresh the comment changed to line #9
 !Screenshot 2021-01-15 at 10.50.22 AM.png|thumbnail! 
# The comment is now moved to a different line from the previous line

h3. Expected Results
* The comment stay on the same line after refreshing the page

h3. Actual Results
* The comment changed to a new line after refreshing the page

h3. Workaround
* Manually refresh the page using the browser refresh instead of using the reload page popup. (This may or may not work) User need to verify the page is properly refreshed or closing and re-opening the page.
fields.summary: Added comment after clicking reload PR page will change the comment line after a web browser refresh

fields.description:
It would be great to be able to invite several users at once instead of going through each email address individually.

As possible suggestions, either expand the invitation search box to enable multiple email addresses to be added, or to read them from a CSV file. 

Another suggestion is to allow invitations for a whole domain when it's a verified one.
fields.summary: Bulk invitation

fields.description: It would be great if, on a build failure, from Pipelines automatically create a ticket and assign it to the person who made the last commit/pull request, with information about what failed etc.
fields.summary: Automatically create a ticket on a build failure

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If there exists an open PR, PR1 from branch1 to main, and try to create a new PR, PR2 from branch1 to main, the PR1 gets overwritten by PR2. 

Data such as comments and inline comments stays the same, however, PR title, description, reviewers and the option to close source branch when merging the PR will be lost and overwritten.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a PR from any branch to another branch, with a unique title and description.
 # Add some comments to this PR.
 # Create another PR with the same source and destination as the first PR, again with a different unique title and description.
 # See that both PRs now have the same title and description, and the comments are now on both PRs

h3. Expected Results

We would expect that before making the second PR, there would be a warning message in the UI that this new second PR would overwrite the original PR title, description, close source branch option, etc.
h3. Actual Results

There is no warning, and so it is often confusing whether or not this is expected behavior, and can lead to loss of PR descriptions + titles.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Creating a second PR with the same source->destination branch pair as an existing PR displays an overwrite warning

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Api response links from /api/2.0/pullrequests/selected_user are invalid

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Make an API call to https://bitbucket.org/api/2.0/pullrequests/selected_user

h3. Expected Results
# Any link on the response works

h3. Actual Results
# The links are returned with an exclamention mark before *api*, e.g.
https://bitbucket.org/!api/2.0/repositories/workspace/repositoryname/pullrequests/38/decline

h3. Workaround
Either remove the "!" using a script or change the URL call to https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/pullrequests/selected_user
fields.summary: Api response links from /api/2.0/pullrequests/selected_user are invalid

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Api response links from /api/2.0/pullrequests/selected_user are invalid

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Make an API call to https://bitbucket.org/api/2.0/pullrequests/selected_user

h3. Expected Results
# Any link on the response works

h3. Actual Results
# The links are returned with an exclamention mark before *api*, e.g.
https://bitbucket.org/!api/2.0/repositories/workspace/repositoryname/pullrequests/38/decline

h3. Workaround
Either remove the "!" using a script or change the URL call to https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/pullrequests/selected_user
fields.summary: Api response links from /api/2.0/pullrequests/selected_user are invalid

fields.description:
It would make automation more assertive if we can get on the API if all the merge checks on the pull request are passed or not.

This can be included in /2.0/repositories/workspace/repo_slug/pullrequests/pull_request_id api
fields.summary: Include Merge checks statuses on /2.0/repositories/workspace/repo_slug/pullrequests/pull_request_id

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
API Calls that take more than 30 seconds fail with HTTP 500 instead of timeout message

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Make an API call that would take more than 30 seconds (ex: huge commits messages)


h3. Expected Results
# a timeout error is shown 

h3. Actual Results
# HTTP 500 error


h3. Workaround
No workaround as this is a limitation of Bitbucket API
fields.summary: API Calls that take more than 30 seconds fail with HTTP 500 instead of timeout message

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If a user specifies the exact name of a branch, a tag, or a bookmark in their yml file, the pipeline defined for the specific branch should override any more generic expressions that would match that branch.

This is not the case when the more generic expression is included in curly brackets.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Bitbucket Cloud repo
 # Create and commit in the repo a bitbucket-pipelines.yml like the following
{code:java}
 image: atlassian/default-image:2

 pipelines:
   branches:
     feature/specific-feature:
       - step:
           script:
             - echo "specific feature pipeline"
     '{feature/*,testing/*}':
       - step:
           script:
             - echo "pipeline for all other feature and testing branches"
 {code}

 # Create from Bitbucket UI a branch named *feature/specific-feature*

h3. Expected Results

The pipeline for *feature/specific-feature* runs
h3. Actual Results

The pipeline for *feature/** runs instead
h3. Workaround

Since the issue occurs when curly brackets are used in the generic expression, you can work around this issue by adjusting the bitbucket-pipelines.yml file to not use curly brackets.

E.g. for the example bitbucket-pipelines.yml above, it could be as follows:
{code:java}
image: atlassian/default-image:2

pipelines:
  branches:
    feature/specific-feature:
      - step:
          script:
            - echo "specific feature pipeline"
    feature/*:
      - step:
          script:
            - echo "pipeline for all other feature and testing branches"
    testing/*:
      - step:
          script:
            - echo "pipeline for all other feature and testing branches"
{code}
Or using yaml anchors as follows:
{code:java}
image: atlassian/default-image:2

definitions:
  steps:
    - step: &feature-testing
        script:
          - echo "pipeline for all other feature and testing branches"
          
pipelines:
  branches:
    feature/specific-feature:
      - step:
          script:
            - echo "specific feature pipeline"
    feature/*:
      - step: *feature-testing
    testing/*:
      - step: *feature-testing
{code}
fields.summary: A pipeline definition for a specific branch does not override a more generic expression when curly brackets are used

fields.description: It would be very useful with an "on hold" icon for CircleCI workflows (among others) that are on hold, rather than using the "in progress" icon, so that one can get that information directly from the pull request list view (and commit list view) instead of having to open up the PR or commit to check the "on hold" information text that is shown beneath the build step name.
fields.summary: Show "On Hold" icon for builds that are on hold

fields.description:
Hi Team,

 

We can create a project and my bit bucket can be part of the project that working very well.

 

Is there a way can manage our Bitbucket Repos hierarchical order.

 
 * One possible solution could be tagging 
 * and Others could be nesting project structure.

Regards

Ashish.
fields.summary: As user I should able to arrange bit buckets repos in hierarchical order

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, we can map existing commits to username aliases at the repository level; other repositories won't share that alias. If the user commits with the same non-mapped alias to multiple repositories, you'll have to add it to those repositories too.
h3. Suggested Solution

Make the username aliases a global user-settable feature, so the user doesn't have to add it to each repository/workspace.
fields.summary: Make the username aliases a global user-settable feature

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Creating a PR from Jira Server, inside a Jira issue, to Bitbucket Cloud branch does not point to the correct branch

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open the Jira Issue on jira server
 # Go to branches
 # Click Create Pull Request
# A Bitbucket screen will show up to fill in to-be-created PR.

h3. Expected Results
# the source branch selected by default should be the same as step 3


h3. Actual Results
# the Source branch selected is not the same as step 3

h3. Workaround
Manually fix the pull request before creating.
fields.summary: Creating a PR from Jira Server to Bitbucket Cloud does get the correct branch as default source

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Updating the destination branch in an open pull request, not updating the description accordingly. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # Create a new PT with source1 and destination1 
 # You'll notice the description of this open PR is an aggregation of all the commit messages
# Now, edit the PR and change the target branch to destination2

h3. Expected Results
The description should be updated with the commit messages accordingly

h3. Actual Results

The same description is retained irrespective of the destination

h3. Workaround

The only workaround is to either decline the PR and create a new one with the right destination or to manually edit the description.
fields.summary: Updating the destination branch in an open pull request, not updating the description accordingly.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary When a transition has a screen associated to it, (regardless of the input required being mandatory or not) it's not possible to transition the issue from Bitbucket Cloud.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Try to transit a PR, where the issue transition has a screen associated to it

h3. Expected Results
* Issue transition screen appears and the issue can be transitioned via PR

h3. Actual Results
* It's not possible to transition the issue

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Unable to transition Jira ticket in PRs when a transition has a screen associated to it

fields.description:
Right now, the only feature what we have in Bitbucket Cloud is sending out an email with the commits, but it doesn't show what parts of the file have changed.

A post-commit hook on repository would be useful that watches the updates to certain files and sends a notification of strings that were added/updated to a specific email address.
fields.summary: Post-commit hook for changes on specific file

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
* The pipeline overview page appears to be static at a certain window size and becomes unresponsive to horizontal scrolling and page content gets hidden. It's not possible to scroll horizontally to view the hidden content.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to the pipelines overview page
# Reduce the size of a browser window
# The content on the become hidden by the browser
# Try scrolling horizontally to view the hidden content 
# Scrolling is not available and content remains hidden

h3. Expected Results
* Page should respond to the size of the window
* Users should be able to scroll horizontally 

h3. Actual Results
* Hidden page content remains hidden
* No way to scroll horizontally

h3. Workaround
* Expand the browser window 
* Reduce the browser zoom to reveal more content on the page
fields.summary: Cannot scroll horizontally on the pipeline overview page

fields.description:
One of the merge checks offered by the branch permissions is "Check the last commit for at least <number> successful builds and no failed builds".
https://support.atlassian.com/bitbucket-cloud/docs/use-branch-permissions/

Here's an example scenario - If all of the following conditions are true:
* One build status is sent as successful to a PR;
* The number of required successful builds is one in the merge check;
* There is a second build running.

Then the merge check will allow you to merge during the execution of the second build, regardless of whether the second build would fail or not.
This triggers a scenario where if the second build fails, the "and no failed builds" rule would block the merge from happening after it's finished, but it's possible to merge the PR in the meantime.

This feature request is to not allow the PR to be merged if there are either failed or running builds, rather than only a failed build.

What you can do at this point is to alter the merge check to wait for two successful builds instead of one, however, this is not ideal since it doesn't account for scenarios where the user would only need to trigger one build for a given PR.
fields.summary: If there are running builds, do not allow the merge checks to pass until the build is completed

fields.description:
On the *Target Branch* filter in the PR list, it would be good to display only the branches which are used as a target in the dropdown and sort them in a specific way, making it easier to browse through target branches and filter PRs.

Also, we could add a hierarchy to the drop displaying branch types such as *BugFix*, *Feature*.. and once the mouse hovers that branch type it expands into the ones created: *Feature/1.1*, *Feature/1.2*...
fields.summary: Improve for the Target Branch filter display in the PR list

fields.description:
Currently, in the old pull request view, the side-by-side diff displays a graphic visualization of where the changes from a certain line of code went to.
 !Screen Shot 2021-01-08 at 11.30.37.png|thumbnail! 

This feature is not available in the New Pull Request Experience

The ask here is to see this feature that was already implemented in the Old Pull Request Experience also available in the New Pull Request experience.
fields.summary: Add line graph for side-by-side view from old pull request to the new pull request experience

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, when you turn the premium feature "Require two-step verification" on, it is applied to all the users with access to private repositories or other private content in the workspace. 
h3. Suggested Solution

Add the ability to keep the required 2sv on for all users but turn it off for specific users in Bitbucket. 

Business case: some companies have service accounts that they do not want to require two-step verification.
fields.summary: Add the ability to keep the "Required 2sv" on for all users but turn it off for specific users in Bitbucket

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, when you want to delete a project, you need to manually move or delete any repositories associated with this project
h3. Suggested Solution

Create an option to transfer all the repositories to another project or to force the deletion by deleting all the repositories associated with the project. 
h3. Workaround

Currently, you can use an [API endpoint to delete the repositories|https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Bworkspace%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D]
fields.summary: Add the ability to delete a project without manually unlink each associated repository

fields.description:
We have our code in Bitbucket and use Azure DevOps build pipelines for CI builds of our iOS and Android mobile apps.

Azure DevOps build pipelines have a build trigger option to validate pull requests. When a developer creates or updates a PR, the trigger builds that PR feature branch and reports the build status in the Bitbucket PR page.

!image-2021-01-06-16-14-05-532.png|width=509,height=285!

 

We'd like to see the Bitbucket capability expanded to allow the merge commit to be built. Or the future merge commit, if you will; the combination of code from the feature branch + the code of the target branch. This will help us better validate that the feature branch doesn't contain any breaking changes with the trunk or target branch, prodiving confidence that the PR is ready to be merged.

From Microsoft's documentation on this feature:
"Each new run builds the latest commit from the source branch of the pull request. This is different from how Azure Pipelines builds pull requests in other repositories (e.g., Azure Repos or GitHub), where it builds the merge commit. *Unfortunately, Bitbucket does not expose information about the merge commit, which contains the merged code between the source and target branches of the pull request.*"

[https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/devops/pipelines/repos/bitbucket?view=azure-devops&tabs=yaml#pr-triggers]
fields.summary: Expose merge commit information for Azure DevOps build pipelines

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently in Bitbucket UI, the only way a user can view or copy a full commit SHA is when selecting the commit and looking at the URL, or hovering the mouse over the short version of the commit.
h3. Expected Results

Would like to request to give users the ability to either have an option in the UI to copy the full commit SHA to the clipboard in Bitbucket UI or change the repository setting to be able to view full SHA in commits view and PR view instead of just the short version.
h3. Actual Results

No ability to copy the full SHA commit from UI apart from taking it from the URL
h3. Workaround

As a workaround the users can use Bitbucket API to obtains a full SHA reference for commits included in the PR by making a call to the following endpoint: 

 
{code:java}
https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Bworkspace%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/pullrequests/%7Bpull_request_id%7D/commits
and you can use the filter in the following way to only obtain the full SHA of PR commits:
https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/Workspace/REPO-SLUG/pullrequests/PR_ID/commits?fields=values.hash,-values.links{code}
And for commits, to only obtain full commit HASH per given branch: 
{code:java}
https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Bworkspace%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/commits
and use the following filter as an example: 
..../repo-slug/commits/master?fields=values.hash, -values.links
 
{code}
Same details for commits can be obtained by running git log locally using various formatting options after cloning the repository.
fields.summary: Provide the ability to users to view/copy full commit SHA in Bitbucket UI

fields.description:
Currently the default description on Pull Requests feature under Repository Settings will overwrite the description generated while a new PR is created. 

Kindly provide an option to keep both
ie, 

1. The default description from repo settings
2. The auto generated description during PR creation.
fields.summary: Default Description Feature Improvement

fields.description:
In the new PR view, the file change summary no longer shows where the comments are located. This makes it impossible to know how many comments there are or which files they pertain to in the PR, unless you either look through the the entire PR, or if you scroll through the activity view in the sidebar.  Neither of these solutions scale well for large PRs and oftentimes comments get lost during review. 

In addition, the activity sidebar view has no way to quickly move through the activity cards. The only way is to use the mouse wheel to scroll up or down. When the PR gets a large amount of activity it's impossible to navigate the activity. 

I am using the latest firefox on Ubuntu 18.04
fields.summary: Make comments available in the file change summary again. Allow for faster navigation of the activity view sidebar

fields.description: Users would be able to better manage their repositories if they had the option of, through the UI, get a complete list of repos with their respective sizes, branch count, and other pertinent information for the admin.
fields.summary: Add repository reports with pertinent info

fields.description:
At the moment, in the new PR experience, whenever a diff is too large to be rendered on the UI, there is no possibility to add a comment to a specific line of code, only to the file itself.
 !Screen Shot 2021-01-05 at 17.13.17.png|thumbnail! 
While the old experience is available, it is possible to switch back to the legacy view, load the file, add a line comment, and when switching back to the new experience, it will be able to see the comment.
 !Screen Shot 2021-01-05 at 17.21.38.png|thumbnail! 
It would be good to have the ability to add these comments in large diffs through the new experience since the legacy PR experience will be sunset and this workaround won't be possible.
fields.summary: Ability to a line comment in large diffs for the new PR experience

fields.description:
Hi,  As a pipe developer it would be nice to have a more elegant way to pass variables, in particular secrets, to pipes. Currently users can setup repo level or workspace level variables, but need to explicitly send them down to pipes.  It would be great if at a pipe level, and/or at a variable setup level, you could mark a variable as "always", which would mean that user defined variable acts like the other default Bitbucket variables (eg build number), so every step gets it, even if the pipe user does not send it down using the variables in the specific pipe step.  This will vastly simplify the users of pipes and prevent a lot of duplicative code in the pipeline yml files eg:  
 
AWS_DEFAULT_REGION: $COMMON_AWS_REGION
AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY: $COMMON_AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY
AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID: $COMMON_AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID
fields.summary: Additional / Custom Default ENV Variables for all pipes (workspace)

fields.description:
Currently, if you add a comment to a line of code and that same line of code is changed/updated, there's no indication that the line code is updated or changed. The comment will then be added to the line of code.
 Now, when you refresh the PR page, the comment is gone and marked as an outdated comment instead.

*Steps to reproduce:*
 # Commit a new file (with code/text)
 # Create a PR
 # Make a change to a line of code and commit + push it
 # Go back to the open PR (without refreshing the page)
 # Add a comment in that same line of code that you've changed
 # Refresh the PR page

This is very confusing to users who are adding valuable comments to a line code not realizing that while they're writing a comment, that same line of code is already updated and their comment will be marked as an outdated comment when they click save.

*Enhancement:*
It would be best to automatically mark the comment as outdated and not add the comment on the line of code.

*Workaround:*
 As a workaround, every time you see the notification on the left side that the PR was updated, please kindly copy the comment you have at that moment, refresh the page, and paste the comment then continue writing the comment again.
 !PR_updated_notif.png!
fields.summary: Mark a PR line of code comment as outdated automatically if that same line of code is updated

fields.description:
Currently, it is only possible to exclude patterns to load on PR's diffs following this [documentation|https://support.atlassian.com/bitbucket-cloud/docs/exclude-files-from-pull-request-diffs/].

It would great for users to be able to exclude these files for the commit view as well, avoiding timeouts when trying to load commit pages.
fields.summary: Ability to exclude files from diffs in commits

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
User are unable to delete branch restrictions on any repository where a branch restriction is created with the pattern /branchname/* (Example: /bugfix/* or /develop/*)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a branch permission with pattern /branchname/*
# Clicking on save throws an error "Unexpected error occurred"
# Clicking on Save again shows the branch permission already exists. 
# Clicking on cancel and refreshing the page shows the branch permission entry with the created name.
# When trying to delete it, the entry disappears but appears back with a refresh.

h3. Expected Results
* The branch permissions entry to be deleted permanently.

h3. Actual Results
* The entry appears back on the branch permissions page. 

h3. Workaround
If you are using SSO to sign in you'll need to use an [App password|https://support.atlassian.com/bitbucket-cloud/docs/app-passwords/] as a replacement for the password in the below API calls.
To set up an App password, go to your personal settings (Click on your avatar on the bottom left) > App passwords > Create app password > Copy it and store it somewhere safe
# Use the 2.0 API to acquire the branch permission IDs from this [endpoint|https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Bworkspace%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/branch-restrictions]
{code:java}
curl -X GET -u userNAme:password https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/WorkspaceID/RepoName/branch-restrictions
{code}
#* If you have `jq` command installed, you may run the following command
{code}
curl --request GET \
  --url https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/<WorkspaceID>/<Repo-Name>/branch-restrictions?pagelen=100 \
  --user "<username>:<AppPassword>" |  jq -c '.values[] | select( .pattern == "/release/*") | .id ' 
{code}
# Use the IDs from step 1 to DELETE the individual restrictions [here|https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Bworkspace%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/branch-restrictions/%7Bid%7D#delete]
{code:java}
curl -X DELETE -u userNAme:password https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/{workspace}/{repo_slug}/branch-restrictions/{id}
{code}
fields.summary: Unable to delete branch permissions created with pattern /branchname/*

fields.description: Hi, As a custom pipe developer it would be very nice for the end users of the pipe to be able to see "steps" within a pipe rolled up individually like multiple steps show when done at the pipeline level.  Currently all logging done within a pipe is displayed as one folding block at one level.  A desired output would be some way to create multiple top level folding outputs within a custom pipe, or perhaps folding outputs at a nested level under the entire step.   And optionally allow custom pipes to show their progress / success/error status at step level.
fields.summary: Folding Logs from Custom Pipe

fields.description:
The new pull request experience moves a lot of useful information to the sidebar to the right. This information was previously found on the front and center of the old pull request view.

Information such as the listing of 'Files changed' which was previously on the middle of the page has now been moved to a new tab on the sidebar on the top right. Similarly, the activity section has also been moved.

Moving the 'Files changed' to the sidebar truncates files with long file names. Resizing the sidebar to reveal the full file name, in turn, will decrease the size of the diff view. 

The sidebar contains a lot of information with lots of collapsable menus. The information contained was previously visible front and center on the old pull request view.

The condensing of information makes it difficult for visually impaired users to see and navigate.
fields.summary: Provide accommodation for visually Impaired users on the new pull request experience
API to fetch default reviewer doesn’t work with UUID's
Remove curly braces from BITBUCKET_PIPELINE_UUID environment variable
API end point to fetch commits excluding merged commits

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When trying to resend one past webhook, it fails with a toast message "Resend webhook failed"

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On your repository settings, go to Webhooks
 # On the chosen hook URL, click on "View Requests" 
 # Click on "View Details" on the call you want to resend.
 # Click on "Resend Request" button.

h3. Expected Results
Webhook is re-triggered with the same message.

h3. Actual Results
A toast message "Resend webhook failed" shows up.

h3. Workaround
Possible Workaround is to re-do the action which triggered the webhook (i.e. a dummy commit, create/update an issue, etc..)
fields.summary: Resend webhooks feature is not working

fields.description:
User prompts have very little top padding and would benefit aesthetically from an increase. Here's a screenshot of the prompt to delete a branch, but I've seen this in other places too:

!image-2020-12-26-15-42-39-232.png!

STR:
 * create a new branch
 * click on "..." and "Delete branch"
fields.summary: Prompts need more top padding

fields.description:
When creating custom reports from Pipelines, it could be helpful to have the repository friendly name available for use in titles.

For example:
BITBUCKET_REPO_SLUG=my-repo
BITBUCKET_REPO_FRIENDLY_NAME=My Repo
fields.summary: Add a "BITBUCKET_REPO_FRIENDLY_NAME" Pipelines variable

fields.description:
Bitbucket Pipelines currently support `includePaths` options in the `condition section:
{code}
          condition:
              changesets:
                 includePaths:
                   # only xml files directly under path1 directory
                   - "path1/*.xml"
                   # any changes in deeply nested directories under path2
                   - "path2/**"
{code}

It will be best that Pipelines supports `excludePaths` option for users who maintained a repository with a large number of directories in it.
* Having the `excludePaths` will increase the yml readability 
* Easy for users to setup yml config when the repo has a large number of directories to track
fields.summary: Support "excludePaths" options in bitbucket-pipelines.yml's `condition` section

fields.description:
When pushing "Create Branch" button on a JIRA Issue, it would be nice to be able to configure the branch name to have a default prefix (like feature/) for all JIRA issue types including Task,etc. 

Currently, it is possible to default the prefix to feature/ only for the bug, feature, and Story issue types and if the JIRA issue is of "task" type, "Other" will be selected by default while creating a branch from JIRA.
fields.summary: Default branch name prefix from JIRA issues

fields.description:
The available pullrequest webhook triggers are not as diverse as what was available in Bitbucket Server.

We used to use a plug-in called 'pull-request-notifier-for-bitbucket' ([https://github.com/tomasbjerre/pull-request-notifier-for-bitbucket)] that was extremely flexible on what could be triggered as part of an 'update' to a pull request:

!image-2020-12-22-15-16-50-669.png!

This worked well for us as we could automatically trigger new PR builds if new commits were added to the source branch in the PR, but we could avoid triggering a new PR build if someone were to update the pull request and edit the title for typo (for example).

Currently in Bitbucket Cloud, we only have the 'Updated' option, and that covers both of these conditions.

!image-2020-12-22-15-19-19-624.png!
fields.summary: PullRequests - Expand 'Updated' webhook trigger into multiple conditions

fields.description:
At the moment, the 'Fork' option for repositories is accessible from the + menu when viewing a repo in Bitbucket Cloud website.

For some users the location of this option is not very obvious.

It has been requested to add the option to 'Fork' a repo in the Source page, along with the 'Clone' option that exists there.
fields.summary: Place the 'Fork' option for a repo in the Source page

fields.description:
When reviewing PRs, comments are left by reviewers. And most of the time code-blocks are used to express the code suggestions/changes. *On creation of a new Code-Block the Language prop should be auto set with language appropriate to the file under which the comment is created. Better is this is also tackled for the inline code* *[#https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BCLOUD-18134]**.*   

1. And when creating a new code-block comment under a file (Ex: JavaScript file), the block is not set by default with an appropriate language. And we have to always select it from the searchable-drop-down. Most of the times developers skip this selection and when viewing the code formatting (Ex: JavaScript code style/colors) is missing. Not giving the reader the feel of the code.
 (See this behavior in the attached video. )

2. Also when having multiple code-blocks in edit mode, the language selector displays the wrongly. Believe it might be a case with props not being updated, maybe a null/undefined check and memorize has something to do with this.
 (See this behavior at 1m9s in the attached video. )
fields.summary: Auto select language in Pull Request Editor Comment/Code-Block....

fields.description:
On the Project Repo list page, there is plenty of room to add a 'Clone' button.  This saves developer time getting a 'clone' command in their clipboard.   Also, maybe, add a 'Clone All' button that would open up a 'notepad' with all the clone commands listed.

!image-2020-12-21-22-34-54-995.png|width=537,height=319!
fields.summary: Add Clone Repo option on Project list of repositories

fields.description:
[https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/search-for-pull-requests-808488581.html]

Filtering supports only target branch. Please addd support for source branch too

 

Thank you!
fields.summary: Add support for filtering PRs by source branch

fields.description: Currently, it is only possible to leave a repo that you don't own through the Bitbucket UI. It would be a good idea to add an endpoint to the REST API in order to leave these repos in which you were added.
fields.summary: API Enpoint to Leave a Repo

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If a repository is transferred to a shared workspace whose 'workspace name' has been changed recently, the repository settings overview page displays the old workspace name in the repository transfer note.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Change workspace name of a shared workspace
 ## Example from test_workspace_old -> test_workspace_new
 !Screen Shot 2020-12-18 at 16.34.12.png|width=234,height=119!
 # Transfer a repository to it
 # The repository settings overview page shows incorrect details
!Screen Shot 2020-12-18 at 16.35.01-1.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results

The latest workspace name should be shown
h3. Actual Results

The older workspace name is displayed
h3. Workaround

This is an issue with the workspace name displayed incorrectly on the UI, however, the transfer functionality is intact.
fields.summary: Repository transfer note on setting page show incorrect workspace name

fields.description: As a Quality Assurance Lead I would like to gather statistics on all the pull requests done, and compare how many PR were merged, declined or marked as Request Changes.
fields.summary: Ability to create reports/statistics on Pull Requests

fields.description:
From what we have seen, with the new PR UI there isn't a way for the PR author to appove their own PR. In order to do this today our company is having to switch back to the old UI. This is quite annoying with our process where we require a separate reviewer as well as the author to both approve a PR before it is built. 

 

It does look like I can decline but not approve.
fields.summary: With the new pull request UI the PR Author Isn't Able to Approve Their Own PR

fields.description:
I would like the ability to manually mark a failed build step as passed for my API tests.

We use pipelines for all of our release steps:

Unit tests

Lint

Security Scan

Database Updates

Deploy

API tests 

*Use Case:*

This particular use case is for our API tests. Our API test provides connectivity to multiple payment gateways via a single API. Most of what we do is call external 3rd party APIs. One of our build steps is to run some 30 API test suites that call out to 30 or so external APIs. The tests make sure we have not broken contracts with those APIs. Unfortunately, there are times here external API are down for maintenance or have bugs of their own. In those situations, we have to manually review the failure. We have no way to mark the test result as acceptable, we are forced to commit code removing that test to move forward. 

*Suggestion*

Add a button next to a failing build step "mark as passed". For us, that is all we need, but I could see people wanting some type of user role required, or for it to only be available for certain steps etc..

note

looked for this in your backlog and didn't see it I think bamboo had a quarantine feature that was much more advanced but provided the same functionality
fields.summary: Mark failing build step as passed

fields.description:
Currently in Bitbucket if a user sets up a webhook that requires authentication, the authorization appears in the Personal Settings under App authorizations.  If a user leaves the organization, the webhook will stop functioning, but there is no way for an administrator to see this.

Ideally in Settings an administrator should be able to see all of these to keep track and manage.
fields.summary: Allow administrators to see all App Authorizations in workspace from Bitbucket user

fields.description:
It will be nice to have a Pipeline Schedule menu that supports Cron Expressions.
Also, It will be nice that the Schedule Pipeline box could be switched to an individual page as it seems pretty small.
fields.summary: Pipeline Scheduler supports Cron Expressions

fields.description:
Currently, the user will have to manually change the repositories avatar but in Sourcetree it automatically populates the repositories avatar from the image in repo with logo.png name.

The user wishes to have this feature in the Bitbucket cloud as well as it will be easier to look for repositories when there are many in the list.
fields.summary: Automatically populating repositories avatar

fields.description:
Why not 'View all' repositories on logging in? Such a waste of time having to tap on 'View all' button. Or at the very least give us an option. Maybe a radio button in settings:
Show: All or Recents on logging in

or something like that. Please!
fields.summary: Show all repositories on logging in. Such a waste of time having to tap on 'View all'

fields.description:
As for now, when inviting a user to a workspace/group/repo, the information that this invitation is being sent to that person's e-mail inbox is only implicitly exposed with the envelope icon on the UI.

Also, when clicking *Add member* on the top of the *User and groups* screen, after the process is complete, the popup window just disappears, being necessary to enter that specific group to confirm that the invitation had been sent.

It would make the process more intuitive to add a message saying that the invitation has been sent to that user's e-mail inbox and he needs to accept it.
fields.summary: Warn about Invitation being sent to e-mail inbox
Add the ability to remove concurrent build protection

fields.description:
In Bitbucket Server, there is an option to disable Git LFS for the entire instance.

It has been asked that we provide admins with the ability to do the same in Bitbucket Cloud, either at the workspace level or at the repo level.
fields.summary: Allow admins to disable Git LFS for a certain workspace or repo

fields.description:
This feature request is to add the ability for users to stop their public Docker images from being cached in the Pipeline or provide them an option to invalidate the specific Public images being cached.

The Pipeline cache the public images for better performance so that the next time when the same image is being used, it uses the image from the cache instead of pulling the image from the registry and saving the network bandwidth. However, when the users make their image from Public to Private in the registry, the Pipeline build doesn't pull the image from the registry (irrespective of authentication provided or not for the registry in the Pipeline configuration) instead they get the older image from the cache which is a bug in the system. This is an issue with the Pipeline and builds using the older image.

There are few workarounds available until the feature is implemented or the bug is fixed for the users to provide an option to stop their public images from being cached or provide an option to invalidate the specific images:
 * Make the image Public again, pull the image from the Pipeline build, and make the image back to Private. This workaround has its own security problem
 * Create a new tag of the image, push it into the registry and use this new tag in the Pipeline build. Since this is a new tag, Pipeline will not use the cached image from the registry instead it will use the image from the Private registry using the credentials provided.
fields.summary: Allow users to stop public Docker images from getting cached

fields.description:
Currently, when you are working in a higher font, the page collapses some of its features such as the left and the right panels which causes a high number of keystrokes to collapse and expand the left navigation.

The ask here is that the main options of the left panel (source, commit, branches, pull requests) are implemented as buttons when the screen is collapsed to avoid having to expand and collapse the navigation menu.
fields.summary: Add navigation buttons when the left menu is collapsed due to resizing the page content as part of the responsiveness of the page

fields.description:
Currently, when working on the pull request page, you have some information displayed horizontally on the right side of the page however there is already a left navigation menu. You have to keep opening and closing the activity panel to have a better view of the content (code) itself.

The ask is that this information is consolidated at the left side menu or in a way that it doesn't take space from the code even when you need to check it.
fields.summary: Move away the activity panel and any right-sided information in Pull Request page

fields.description:
Right now when I download the sources using curl with https://bitbucket.org/<org>/<repo>/get/<tag>.tar.gz the downloaded tar contains a repository specific main folder then the contents.

I've figured out that there is a path parameter (though it wasn't easy to find) which can reduce the repository to a subpath.

Is there a one which removes that ugly prefix?

It would be quite useful to put such a links to automatic build pipelines which would accept compressed archive urls, but the folder structure inside the archive is strict.
fields.summary: Have an option to Download Sources without the top folder

fields.description:
When an invitation email is sent, the sender of the email is in a format of:
noreply+SomeLargeID@am.atlassian.com

E.G.:
noreply+d1cab625a4905e85730d7d08b897f891480f97bef48b9abffd529687@am.atlassian.com

However, the sender information of the email looks like a phishing attempt causing customers to miss it or to avoid clicking on it.

It would be great if Bitbucket could have a single email to send all notifications or at least a standard email to send notifications.
fields.summary: Change the sender of invitation emails

fields.description:
The new "Request Changes" review status is great. But I'd like to be able to indicate when I've made the requested changes and request my PR be re-reviewed. Specifically I'd like this to be apparent in the Pull Requests view.

My team primarily uses Bitbucket to manage peer review. We all check the Pull Requests view multiple times per day. If I've reviewed an issue already, I don't want to have to check my email or click through to each PR to see if the author has made subsequent changes, and either ask or try to guess whether they feel they've addressed all my comments.
fields.summary: Request re-review of a PR

fields.description:
Customer's Feedback:

In new experience, I see a bright green checkmark Call To Action asking me to get off my butt already and Approve this PR before the author comes to me sobbing asking why I pick on him and never approve his commits. Icon should read past tense “Approved” rather than imperative “Approve”.
fields.summary: Change the "Approve" word to "Approved"

fields.description: I tend to create a .gitignore for every new project, and it just causes unnecessary headache when I want to quickly create a remote repository and deploy my local codebase.
fields.summary: Don't default gitignore creation to yes when creating a new project

fields.description:
my pull request author filter contains 50% disabled accounts from people who left te company years ago.

It would be useful to either filter those out/sort them to be on the bottom of the list. Or maybe even better add some recent used/active score to and sort on that.

So we have relevant options showing.

!image-2020-12-15-11-05-04-543.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Pull request author filter: add some relevant sorting (most used?)

fields.description:
Please add the ability to specify non-existing branch (with confirmation) as a target branch in PR. Upon approval and merge the new branch will be created and PR merged into it.

It is very helpful when users do not have permissions to write into stable branches directly, but via approved PR's only.

Right now someone else has to create a stable branch first, and only then others may merge into it.
fields.summary: Ability to create a destination branch on successful approval of a pull request
Comment Centric Pull Request Review Experience
History rewrite feature in Bitbucket

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Pipeline onboarding Wizard doesn't appear when Click on _*Repository settings->PIPELINES->Settings*_ and enable the Pipeline by toggling _*Enable Pipelines*_
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new repository
 # Click on _*Repository settings->PIPELINES->Settings*_
 # Toggle the button _*Enable Pipelines*_ to enable the Pipeline
 # A screen appears to configure and commit a *bitbucket-pipelines.yml* file into the repository. Click on _*Configure bitbucket-pipelines.yml*_ button

h3. Expected Results

The Pipeline onboarding Wizard should appear to configure the Bitbucket Pipeline
h3. Actual Results

When you click on the Configure bitbucket-pipelines.yml button, the pipeline onboarding Wizard does not appear, instead, you get the message: "Hooray! You've successfully set up Pipelines."
h3. Workaround

You can follow one of the following workarounds:
 # Create bitbucket-peipelines.yml file manually and commit into the repository
You can use the [Validator|https://bitbucket-pipelines.prod.public.atl-paas.net/validator] to check the file.
 # Or follow the steps mentioned in the below documentation link to set up the pipelines:[Get started with Bitbucket Pipelines|https://support.atlassian.com/bitbucket-cloud/docs/get-started-with-bitbucket-pipelines/]
fields.summary: Pipeline onboarding Wizard doesn't appear

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, it's not possible to self-approve a PR with the new pull request experience. 
h3. Suggested Solution
 Add the ability to self-approve a PR with the new pull request experience. 
h3. Workaround 
Switch to the Old PR view to approve the PR
fields.summary: Ability to self-approve a PR with the new pull request experience

fields.description:
It would be great to be able to click a one-click-button and get the form to submit a ticket to Bitbucket.

Currently, you have to open a different site (support.atlassian.com) and login to be able to submit the ticket.
fields.summary: Allow support tickets to be submitted directly through Bitbucket UI

fields.description:
h3. Description

Users intermittently unable to upload Binary files (PDF, exe, Jar etc.) in Downloads section in Bitbucket UI. The upload doesn't happen and receive 499 and then 502 status code.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Upload Binary files (PDF, exe, Jar etc.) in Downloads section in UI
 *Error message* \{"You must solve the captcha"}
Reference bug ticket: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BCLOUD-20165

Suggestions:
 The following "You must solve the captcha" error message should be changed to *"Upload failed. Please try uploading this file via the API. See HERE for details."*
fields.summary: Display a warning or error message saying "Upload failed. Please try uploading this file via the API. See HERE for details." instead of  "You must solve the captcha"
